p: Inhibitors of HO activity are metalloporphyrins, which do not carry an iron molecule but are replaced by tin, chromium, or zinc, inhibit the rate limiting enzyme heme oxygenase [ 9, 10, 11, 12, 13, 14, 15]. Tin (Sn 4+) has been used to lower bilirubin levels in newborns to treat hyperbilirubinemia in newborns [ 6]. HO-1 cleaves the tetrapyrrole ring at the methylene bridge to produce carbon monoxide (CO) biliverdin, and iron [ 6, 16]. Biliverdin is reduced to bilirubin by biliverdin reductase in mammals. Since COVID-19 binds porphyrin and removes iron and oxygen to form a COVID-19-Porphyrin complex, it can behave as a metalloporphyrin and competitively inhibits HO-1 ( Figure 3) [ 17].
